text.tspan: the ball trails particles as it moves
if the ball collides with any obstacles or paddles it makes them recoil
depending on how hard the ball collides with anything, the screen may shake, and spark effects are emitted
everything is physical, the ball will lose energy over time
the paddles are controlled with an elastic constraint
the players will freely move around the constraint's base, but the paddles will be restricted to the paddle area
the players can hit the ball extra hard with the vertical leeway the paddle area offers, strong hits will shake the screen even more
the paddles need to be able to rotate on their constraint as they're moved around, rotation can exceed paddle area
the paddles will elastically straighten themselves if they become rotated
a player can lose if either the ball goes outside the screen on their half,
or it loses energy and stops on their half
when a player loses their ball the score screen will show
the screen background will quickly slide in from the losing player's side
the score points will then be drawed as they were before the current loss
and then snappily the losing player's score will be changed
if no player loses,
(obstacles will be deleted out of screen),
and the screen backdrop will slide out on the player who will receive the ball
a ball will spawn on the screen and be pushed on the receiving player's side
as the game progresses, obstacle shapes will be created in their region
they can animate any way they want, as long as they remain within their region
the obstacles should never form a permanent wall on the screen,
they should appear in groups and then not appear for a while again
and they should always allow some gaps in their formation to pass the ball through
if a player runs out of points, they lose,
that player's paddle and points and the ball is turned black,
then the screen waits for confirmation
upon which the black backdrop covers the screen and the menu shows up
the menu shows the empty play-field
perhaps the empty paddle areas flash accent color after a while, as a hint of what to do
when a player touches their side of the field a paddle is generated
when both oaddles have been generated,
the game begins with a ball spawning in the center
and randomly shooting out in one half
hello pong
